com.github.ocraft.s2client.bot.gateway

Interface QueryInterface


  • public interface QueryInterface
    The QueryInterface provides additional data not contained in the observation.

    Performance note: - Always try and batch things up. These queries are effectively synchronous and will block until returned.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods

      default List<Point> calculateExpansionLocations(ObservationInterface observation, DebugInterface debug, ExpansionParameters parameters)
      Calculates expansion locations, this call can take on the order of 100ms since it makes blocking queries to SC2 so call it once and cache the results.

    • Method Detail

      • getAbilitiesForUnit

        AvailableAbilities getAbilitiesForUnit(Unit unit,
                                       boolean ignoreResourceRequirements)
        Returns a list of abilities represented as a AvailableAbilities see the Abilities enum for their corresponding, named, representations.
        Parameters:
        unit - Unit.
        ignoreResourceRequirements - Ignores food, mineral and gas costs, as well as cooldowns.
        Returns:
        Abilities for the unit.

      • getAbilitiesForUnits

        List<AvailableAbilities> getAbilitiesForUnits(List<Unit> units,
                                              boolean ignoreResourceRequirements)
        Issues multiple available abilities queries. Batch version.
        Parameters:
        units - Units.
        ignoreResourceRequirements - Ignores food, mineral and gas costs, as well as cooldowns.
        Returns:
        Abilities for the units.

      • pathingDistance

        float pathingDistance(Point2d start,
                      Point2d end)
        Returns pathing distance between two locations. Takes into account unit movement properties (e.g. Flying).
        Parameters:
        start - Starting point.
        end - End point.
        Returns:
        Distance between the two points.

      • pathingDistance

        float pathingDistance(Unit start,
                      Point2d end)
        Returns pathing distance between a unit and a target location. Takes into account unit movement properties (e.g. Flying). Batch version.
        Parameters:
        start - Starting points.
        end - End points.
        Returns:
        Distances between the two points.

      • pathingDistance

        List<Float> pathingDistance(List<QueryPathing> queries)
        Issues multiple pathing queries.

      • placement

        boolean placement(Ability ability,
                  Point2d target)
        See Also:
        placement(Ability, Point2d, Unit)

      • placement

        boolean placement(Ability ability,
                  Point2d target,
                  Unit unit)
        Returns whether a building can be placed at a location. The placing unit field is optional. This is only used for cases where the placing unit plays a role in the placement grid test (e.g. A flying barracks building an add-on requires room for both the barracks and add-on).
        Parameters:
        ability - Ability for building or moving a structure.
        target - Position to attempt placement on.
        unit - (Optional) The unit that is moving, if moving a structure.
        Returns:
        If placement is possible.

      • placement

        List<Boolean> placement(List<QueryBuildingPlacement> queries)
        A batch version of the above Placement query. Takes an array of abilities, positions and optional unit tags and returns a matching array of booleans indicating if placement is possible.
        Parameters:
        queries - Placement queries.
        Returns:
        Array of booleans indicating if placement is possible.

      • calculateExpansionLocations

        default List<Point> calculateExpansionLocations(ObservationInterface observation,
                                                DebugInterface debug,
                                                ExpansionParameters parameters)
        Calculates expansion locations, this call can take on the order of 100ms since it makes blocking queries to SC2 so call it once and cache the results.
        Parameters:
        debug - If filled out CalculateExpansionLocations will render spheres to show what it calculated.

      • calculateExpansionLocations

        default List<Point> calculateExpansionLocations(ObservationInterface observation)

      • calculateExpansionLocations

        default List<Point> calculateExpansionLocations(ObservationInterface observation,
                                                DebugInterface debug)

      • cluster

        static Map<Point,List<UnitInPool>> cluster(List<UnitInPool> units,
                                           float distanceApart)
        Clusters units within some distance of each other and returns a list of them and their center of mass.
